publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1516 Jackson Carlaw: Prostate Cancer Awareness Week—That the Parliament welcomes Prostate Cancer Awareness Week which begins on 10 March 2008 and the accompanying campaign, Real Men Do; notes that prostate cancer is the second most common cancer found among men and the third most common form of cancer death, demonstrating the need to encourage men in particular to increase awareness of their personal health issues; calls for awareness of prostate and testicular cancer to be raised to the same level as, for example, breast cancer which has benefited from excellent awareness raising campaigns over recent years, and encourages people from all walks of life to support Prostate Cancer Awareness Week and Real Men Do to help improve research, information and support services for men and their families affected by this disease and to increase early diagnosis of the disease, thereby increasing survival rates.

S3M-1516 Prostate Cancer Awareness Week (lodged on 7 March 2008) Bill Wilson*, Bill Butler*, Alasdair Allan*, John Park*, Jamie McGrigor*, Nanette Milne*, Elizabeth Smith*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Bill Kidd*, Rob Gibson*, Robin Harper*, Robert Brown*, Bob Doris*, Jamie Stone*, James Kelly*, Sandra White*, Ross Finnie*, Helen Eadie*

S3M-1516 Prostate Cancer Awareness Week (lodged on 7 March 2008) Hugh O’Donnell*, Karen Whitefield*, Bashir Ahmad*, Alex Neil*, Ted Brocklebank*, Jim Tolson*, Kenneth Gibson*, Elaine Murray*, Jackie Baillie*, Murdo Fraser*, Margaret Mitchell*, Ken Macintosh*, Angela Constance*, Brian Adam*, John Lamont*, Mary Scanlon*, Trish Godman*, Derek Brownlee*, Jamie Hepburn*, Liam McArthur*
S3M-1516 Prostate Cancer Awareness Week (lodged on 7 March 2008) Des McNulty*, Bill Aitken*, Roseanna Cunningham*
S3M-1516 Prostate Cancer Awareness Week (lodged on 7 March 2008) Jack McConnell*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Gil Paterson*, Irene Oldfather*
S3M-1516 Prostate Cancer Awareness Week (lodged on 7 March 2008) Elaine Smith*

S3M-1516 Prostate Cancer Awareness Week (lodged on 7 March 2008) John Scott*
